review_title: Operates like a start-up, wants to be an innovator
pros:
Lots of nice people work at Thrive and it's a nice place to work.
The head office is modern
Plenty of work to keep you busy
Funding for training exists
Working from home is strongly supported
HR team are proactively trying increase staff involvement, encouraging healthier lifestyles.
Recent changes in 2 director roles has brought in new and fresh/positive thinking to one side of the business (since 2020)
cons:
Not much space or support for internal promotion into senior roles. They mostly recruit from outside for higher roles.
Benefits are limited
CEO is practically non-existent 
1 or 2 rotten eggs sitting in senior leadership positions and you can see their influence right through the teams who report into them.
The IT managed service provider are constantly changing and breaking things which is frustrating. Constant need to reboot the laptop!

job_title: Assistant Director in Watford, East of England, England
pros: I feel totally respected across the whole company. The flexibility this role offers me is great. Don't get me wrong it's a demanding organisation but they do listen when you say "wow I'm not sure I can take more on"!  The opportunities to work on new projects is there for the taking.
cons: They haven't quite managed to recruit staff with the same good behaviours. They are striving to improve culture and staff behaviour but a leopard doesn't change their spots. But once that is tackled it will be an amazing place to work.

pros: There are some very hardworking people here who are a pleasure to work with.
cons: Senior Management has a couple of bad apples, one who has really tried hard to change, but one who just wont entertain that her attitude is poisonous and creates a toxic workplace for pretty much everybody she comes into contact with. The company don't seem to care.
